optionalfeature.name: Ambidextrous

prerequisite.other: Barbarian, Fighter, Monk, Paladin, Pugilist, Ranger, Rogue, Swordmage

entries: The additional attack you make with your offhand while two-weapon fighting is made as part of the Attack action rather than using your bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Better Criticals
entries: You critically hit on attacks rolled one number lower.
For instance, if you would crit on 20, you would now crit on a 19 as well

optionalfeature.name: Climber
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. You have advantage on ability checks related to climbing.

optionalfeature.name: Covert Strike
entries: Once on your turn, when you critically hit with an attack or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack, you can also attempt to hide as a part of the same action.
If you have any movement left for this turn, you can use it to move before attempting to hide, and you must adhere to the normal restrictions for being able to hide.

optionalfeature.name: Feathery Steps
entries: You take no disadvantage on Stealth (Dexterity) checks as a consequence of wearing armor.
You do not trigger non-magical traps triggered by stepping on them.

optionalfeature.name: Hexen
entries: You learn how to imbue a tiny Hex onto a weapon of your choice.
Over the course of a short or long rest, choose one weapon and one type of damage: necrotic, radiant or psychic. You then inscribe a small curse on to a charm and place it onto the weapon.

Afterwards, as a bonus action you can activate the Hex. For the next hour, the weapon is imbued by the small curse, increasing its damage dealt by 1d4 of the chosen type. Your maximum hit points are reduced by 1 per character level while the Hex is active. At 11th level, the Hex damage increases to 1d6.
You can end the Hex as a bonus action, and any lost hit points are regained.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Initiative
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to your initiative.
Whenever you roll for initiative and the result of the d20 is a 6 or lower, you can treat it as a 7.

optionalfeature.name: Luckless Talent
entries: Whenever you perform an attack roll, ability check or saving throw and you roll a 20 on a d20, you can choose to critically fail instead, as the tides of luck change unexpectedly.

After doing so, at any point until your next long rest, you can choose to use your 'unspent' luck and treat any d20 you roll as a 20. You can only have one critical saved at a time and once you use this feature, you can't use it again until your next long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Swift Pivoting
entries: You can move through other creature's spaces, regardless of alliance or size, and this movement does not count as difficult terrain for you.
Enemies have disadvantage on attacks of opportunity against you.

optionalfeature.name: Swimmer
entries: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and you have advantage on ability checks related to swimming.
You can also hold your breath underwater for up to 10 minutes if you take a breath beforehand.

optionalfeature.name: Unnarmed and All Natural
entries: Your unarmed strikes and attacks with natural weapons count as being magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity against non-magical attacks.
Additionally, if you are not wielding any weapons, your unarmed or natural weapon attacks have a bonus +1 to damage.

optionalfeature.name: Under Pressure

prerequisite.other: Be able to cast and prepare spells

entries: Once per long rest, you may take an action to remember a spell you know, but did not prepare, and instantly prepare it for use. When you do so, you must unprepare a different spell to make room for it.

optionalfeature.name: Vault and Crash
entries: Your long jump increases by 15 ft, and your high jump increases by 5 ft. You have resistance to fall damage.

optionalfeature.name: Attuning Catalyst
entries: You modify your spellcasting focus to help you with your attunements. You gain one additional attunement slot.

optionalfeature.name: Catalysed Overcast
entries: You can create a special type of catalyst that allows you to cast spells beyond you comprehension. This catalyst can be your spellcasting focus.

When you take this feature at 6th level, choose a 3rd level spell from the Wizard spell list. You can cast this spell once or upcast a spell you know at 3rd level. After you use this feature, you gain one level of exhaustion and can't do it again until you finish a long rest.
At 10th level, you can swap the spell you chose for a 4th level spell from the wizard list, or upcast a spell once at 4th level.
At 14th level, you can swap it for a 5th level spell or upcast a spell once at 5th level.
At 18th level, you can swap it for a 6th level spell or upcast a spell once at 6th level.

optionalfeature.name: Deep Pocketed
entries: You develop small pockets with magically embued extradimensional space, specialized on quick access. Each pocket is capable of holding a single mundane or magical item, such as a potion or alchemists' fire, but you cannot use scrolls. You can have a number of active pockets equal to your proficiency bonus and you prepare them at the end of a long rest.

As a bonus action on your turn, one of the items pops out of its pocket and into your hand after which you can immediately use it as part of the same bonus action, so long as the item can be used as an action (Use an Object action or its own action) and is properly attuned by you (if required). You cannot use this feature to use a weapon or equip armor.

As you activate one of the pockets, it quickly collapses the extradimensional space and ejects the item into your hand, in order to hasten the item's usage. The used pocket cannot then be used again until you magically reactivate it by preparing the items on each pocket over the course of a long rest.

At 6th level in this class, you learn how to activate scrolls quickly using this feature. When you do so, you must make an ability check using your spellcasting ability to sucessfully cast the spell. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a failure, the spell fails and the scroll is consumed.

optionalfeature.name: Hasty Reconstruction
entries: You learn one additional Infusion Known. Once per short rest, as an action, you can immediately end one of your active infusions and infuse another item with one infusion you know.

optionalfeature.name: Homunculus Swarm

prerequisite.other: Homunculus Servant Infusion or Steel Defender

entries: You can upgrade your companion to a swarm of tiny-sized homunculi. The swarm has a 0ft melee range and can occupy a creatures' space. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
Its damage is 2d4 + proficiency bonus when the swarm is over half its maximum hit points and goes down to 1d4 + proficiency bonus when its below it.

As a bonus action, you can order the swarm to split into two. When you do so, the swarm divides into two creatures, with half your companion's maximum and current hit points and their attacks deal 1d4 + proficiency bonus.
Whenever you order your Homunculus to perform an action, you can give a different order to each half of the swarm.

optionalfeature.name: Infused Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Prolific Inventor
entries: Your time spent crafting and tinkering has turned you into an expert at item crafting.
When crafting a mundane or magical item (PHB p. 187, DMG p. 128), the cost for materials is halved and if you must perform any checks in order to craft the item, you may do so at advantage.

During your adventures, you can perform one day worth of progress towards your item as light activity on a long rest. During downtime, you can make 4 days worth of progress towards your item each day.

Additionally, if the item you are trying to craft requires a recipe, you do not need to know it to produce the item if it is on your *Replicate Magic Item* list. If the item is not on the list, and you do not know that recipe, you often know where and from whom you can obtain it.

optionalfeature.name: Wait... I Have an Idea
entries: You gain the ability to make a makeshift prototype of an item bearing any infusion from the artificer infusions list, (including Replicate Magic Item). This item does not count towards your number of active infusions.
You must spend 1 minute making the item to successfully create it, or you can make a DC 15 check using your artisan's tool to make it during an action.

This item lasts for one use if it has any charges or spellcasting related to it, or 10 minutes. You needn't know the infusion used or have knowledge of the magic item beforehand, but you cannot improvise an item or infusion you already have as an active infusion.
Once you successfully use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Big Hands
entries: You have large hands and a strong grip. While raging, you can engage in Two Weapon Fighting with Versatile and Heavy weapons, as if you were holding them with Two Hands.
You must be medium-sized to do so, and your attacks are made at a -4 penalty.
If your Strength score is at least 20, your attack rolls are made ate a -2 penalty.
If your Strength score is 22 or higher, you do not suffer any penalty from using this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Fight Me
entries: While raging, as a bonus action you can willingly open yourself to strikes in a taunting manner. When you do so, you take a -2 penalty to your AC and Dexterity saving throws until the start of your next turn. If you are hit with a melee attack while taunting in this way, you may make an attack or grapple against the enemy as a reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Gorilla Throws
entries: Your throws hurt. A lot. Your Rage and Reckless Attack features can also be used with thrown weapons using Strength. While raging, you may draw a thrown weapon as part of the action you use to throw it. Additionally, whenever you have advantage on a ranged attack roll you make with a thrown weapon and hit, you can also knock a Large or smaller target prone if the lower of the two d20 rolls would also hit the target.

optionalfeature.name: Inner Storm
entries: You learn how to harness your rage and focus it, controlling the storm inside you. While raging, every one of your features that requires you to use Strength (such as Rage damage or Reckless attacks) can be done using Dexterity instead of Strength. This, however, does not allow you to make attacks using your Dexterity modifier if the weapon you are wielding does not have the Finesse property.

optionalfeature.name: Instinctive Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Leap Slam
entries: You are too angry to walk to your enemies. While raging, if you are wielding a weapon with two hands, you may use your action to perform a long jump towards an enemy you can see and attack it once as part of the same action.

To do so, you must spend 5ft of movement as part of the same action. You only spend 5ft of your movement for the turn regardless of distance traveled, and rules for a running long jump still apply. If the attack connects, you roll twice the weapon's dice for damage.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Superiority: Barbarian
entries: When you choose this feature, you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

You learn two maneuvers of your choice from the Barbarian list. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You gain one additional maneuver when you reach 10th level in this class. When you gain a level in this class you may choose to replace a known maneuver for a different one.

{@b Superiority Dice.} You have two Superiority dice, which are d6s. A Superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 10th level in this class.
{@b Saving Throws.} Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Natural Warrior
entries: You are a warrior attuned to the nature around you. You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Druid spell list. In addition, choose one 1st level spell from the same list. Using this feature, you can cast the spell once at its lowest level, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells. You can cast and concentrate on the spells you gain from this feature while raging.

optionalfeature.name: Threatening Presence
entries: Your savagery wrecks the spirit of your enemies. While raging, when you critically strike an enemy, it must make a Wisdom saving throw versus 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier.
If it fails, the enemy is frightened by you for one minute. At the end of its turn it can repeat the save to end the effect. An enemy can only be frightened by you in this way once every dawn.
You have +2 to your attack rolls against enemies frightened by you.

optionalfeature.name: Utmost Fury
entries: You may cast Enlarge (as if from the Enlarge/Reduce spell) on yourself as an action once without spending a spell slot. Casting in this way does not require concentration and can be done while raging.
Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest. You gain an additional use of this feature when you reach 10th level.

optionalfeature.name: Battle Hymn
entries: You are able to perform and inspire even in the heat of combat.
As an action, you can spend a Bardic Inspiration die to start performing a Battle Hymn.

Until your next turn, or until you lose concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell), every ally of yours that can hear you within 30ft has the benefits of half a Bardic Inspiration die (rounded up) to their next roll.

Additionally, every enemy that can hear you within 30ft has to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. If the enemy fails, they are disturbed by your song. While disturbed, they must subtract half a bardic inspiration die (rounded up) from their next attack roll or saving throw.

You may spend your action and an additional Bardic Inspiration die to extend this performance on each of your turns. Extending the performance grants new Bardic Inspiration dice to your allies and enemies who can hear you must make another Wisdom saving throw.
Once you use this feature you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Battle Swagger
entries: You swirl and swagger in combat, attacking from unexpected angles.

As a bonus action, you can make sudden and unexpected movements to beguile an enemy. Make a contested Charisma (Deception) against the enemy's Wisdom (Insight). On a success, for a number of turns equal to your proficiency bonus, the enemy is enthralled by your movement.
While your target is enthralled, once on each of your turns, you can roll a die equal to your Bardic Inspiration die and add to your damage when you hit an enemy with a weapon attack.
The extra damage dealt by your Battle Swagger feature increases by one die at 6th, at 12th and 18th levels, to a maximum of 4.

optionalfeature.name: Bearer of Secrets
entries: You are known for holding multiple secrets. You learn one additional spell for your Magical Secrets feature, and your number of spells known increases accordingly.

optionalfeature.name: Endless Inspiration
entries: You are an endless source of inspiration to your allies. You gain additional Bardic Inspiration dice equal to half your Charisma modifier (rounded down, to a minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Flash of Inspiration
entries: You have a knack for performing well with little experience. Twice per long rest, you can expend a Bardic Inspiration die to make an ability check you are not proficient with as if you had Expertise in it.

optionalfeature.name: Folklore
entries: You are knowledgeable on culture, music and traditions, gaining the following benefits according to your Charisma Score:
• 14 - You gain proficiency with an additional instrument. You can replicate any song or dance after seeing it being performed once.
• 16 - You learn two additional non-exotic languages of your choice.
• 18 - You have advantage on ability checks relating to information on culture, lore and traditions.
• 20 - Your total number of known spells increases by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Inspirational Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Masterwork Performance
entries: Your performances are legendary. Choose one type of instrument you are proficient with. You become a specialist in this instrument. When you use it to make a Performance (Charisma) roll, you can treat any die roll on the d20 below 8 as being an 8. Additionally, once a day you may spend a Bardic Inspiration die and add it to that roll.

optionalfeature.name: Dogmatic Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Emissary of the Divine
entries: You gain an additional use of your Channel Divinity feature.

optionalfeature.name: Holy Token
entries: Your holy symbol becomes a ward against the unholy. Damage you take from Fiends or Undead is reduced by a number equal to your proficiency modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Impositio Manus
entries: You gain the blessing of a Celestial (if you're good) or Fiendish (if you're evil) creature. The blessing appears as an immaterial floating light, of yellowish/redish color.

As a bonus action you can place this blessing on an ally of your choice that you can see within 60ft. The ally has +1 to AC and deals 1d4 radiant/necrotic damage to any enemy who makes a melee attack against them.

You can change the ally who receives this benefit as a bonus action. It lasts until you change the target of it, you are further than 60ft from your target, either of you gets knocked unconscious or until the next dawn.
Additionally, you can use your action to forego its regular effects and make it emit bright light to 20ft and dim light to 40ft, and you can move it up to 30ft on your turn (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Preparation
entries: You can prepare an additional spell on your list of prepared spells. This bonus increases to two additional spells at 10th level and three additional spells at 18th.

optionalfeature.name: Sheperd of the Weak
entries: When you use your Divine Intervention feature, your deity intervenes when you roll a number equal to or lower than your Cleric level + 2x your Wisdom modifier. When you reach 20th level, and upgrade your Divine Intervention feature, you regain the use of your Divine Intervention after 4 days instead of 7.

optionalfeature.name: Striken
entries: When you gain your Divine Strike feature, you can apply its damage on any attacks you make, rather than once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Thoughts and Prayers
entries: As a reaction when an enemy attacks an ally of yours within 30ft of you, you may spend a use of your Channel Divinity to pray for their well being. Until the start of your next turn, enemies have disadvantage in attack rolls against them.

optionalfeature.name: Turn the Unholy
entries: The undead bear no match to the visage of your symbol. The CR rating of your Turn Undead feature increases by one step. (1/2 - 1 - 2 - 3 - 4 - 5)

optionalfeature.name: Druidic Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Goodmerry
entries: You gain proficiency with brewers supplies and you can add your proficiency modifier to checks you make using them.
You learn how to make wine from goodberries, which nourishes you for a full day, heals and grants magical benefits.
Before a long rest you must begin the brewing process, by using 10 goodberries, brewing ingredients worth 20sp and magic, you can quickly make wine after the end of this long rest.

Each fermentation process provides 1d4 bottles of wine. When you finish the long rest, make a wisdom check using your Brewer's Supplies. This determines the quality of the wine and its effects (effects listed last for 1 minute):
DC <13: Regular quality. Heals 2d4 + Brewer's Wisdom modifier
DC 13: Adept quality. Heals 2d6 + Brewer's Wisdom modifier. Advantage on saving throws against the charmed and frightened conditions.
DC 15: Great quality. Heals 3d6 + Brewer's Wisdom modifier.  Advantage on saving throws against the charmed and frightened conditions.
DC 20: Remarkable quality. Heals 3d6 + Brewer's Wisdom modifier. Advantage on saving throws against the charmed and frightened condition. Resistance to poison.
The wine can be consumed as an action. Goodberry Wine becomes regular wine and loses its magical properties if it is not consumed within 24hrs.

optionalfeature.name: Herbal Healer
entries: You gain resistance to poison and proficiency with Herbalism Kit and Alchemist's Supplies, which you can use to make poisons and medicine. Your Herbalism kit acts as a Poisoner's kit for you.
You can make a check using your Herbalism Kit or Alchemist Supplies instead of a Medicine check when trying to stabilize a creature or when trying to study poison or a poisoned creature.

optionalfeature.name: Loremaster
entries: You are deeply attuned to nature and its lore.
You gain the following benefits according to your Wisdom Score:
• 14 - You know the Speak with animals spell and always have it prepared. You can cast it without spending a spell slot.
• 16 - You have advantage on Animal Handling checks.
• 18 - You learn Sylvian and Primordial.
• 20 - Difficult terrain does not impair your movement in a non-Urban environment.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Resistance
entries: Choose one element of nature (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder), you gain resistance to that element.

You may also spend one hour during your long rest in a meditative communion with nature and a source of one of the elements of your choice (such as a bonfire or the pouring rain) to switch your resistance to that element.

optionalfeature.name: Shapeshifter
entries: You gain exceptional control over your wild shape.
While under the effects of Wild Shape, you can use your action to change to a different creature of your choice without spending an additional use of wild shape.
When you do so, your new hit points will be equal to the lowest between your current hit points or the new creature's maximum hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit of the First Ones
entries: You are imbued with the spirit of one of the primordial sources in nature: Beasts, Elements and Vegetation.
As an action you can bring forth one of the spirits, for the following effect:

{@b Beastborn.} Your body changes to be more akin to that of a Beast. Your speed increases by 5, and you gain natural weapons to make unarmed attacks, its die is a d6. If you already have natural weapons, their dice increases by one size (d4 - d6 - d8).
You gain an odor akin to that of an animal, and you have disadvantage with charisma checks against non-Beasts. Your appearance might change to be unusually hairy or bulky.

{@b Elementborn.} Your body represents the elements of nature. When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for a spell that deals elemental damage, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2.

You emit a dim light of 5ft around you, there's always a cool breeze in a 5ft radius around you and your footsteps are wet. Your skin might look like it is constantly moving like a river, or your hair might shift and move even without a breeze.
{@b Treantborn.} Your body changes to be more akin to that of a Tree. You are always under the effect of the Barkskin spell and its bonus is increased by 1.
Your speed is reduced by 5. You grow in height (your size category remains the same), your skin becomes bark-like and branches and flowers may sprout out of your hair.
You can take another action the end the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Verdant Empathy
entries: You can cast Speak With Plants at will without expending a spell slot.
When you do so using this feature, you cannot use its effects to change terrain into or from being difficult terrain or to interfere with other spells (such as entangle).

You can, however, communicate with plants as normal, but they will only follow your orders if the natural spirits of the location you are in were already inclined to help you (at the DM's discretion).

optionalfeature.name: Action Hero
entries: You have the grit of a Hero.
You gain one additional use of your Action Surge.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Stances
entries: You change your approach given the challenge.
You learn two stances when you take this feature, described below. You may take this feature again to gain two additional stances.

As a bonus action, you may choose to take a combat stance. Each stance lasts until the start of your next turn and are lost if you are knocked back, prone, restrained, or unconscious. You may only have one stance active at one time.
{@b Cleaving Stance.} You take a stance to prepare yourself to fight multiple targets.

When you take this stance, the next time you hit an enemy with a weapon you are wielding with two hands, you can also make attack rolls against any enemies that are within 5ft of your enemy and within your reach. Each surrounding enemy hit takes half damage.

{@b Parrying Stance.} When you enter parrying stance, select an enemy you wish to focus on. The next time this enemy makes an attack roll against you, you may use your reaction to try to intercept it. When you do so, roll an attack roll with your wielded weapon, if the roll is higher than your enemies', you take half damage from the attack.

{@b Tunnel Stance.} While in your defensive stance, once per round you can make an opportunity attack without using your reaction. Additionally, creatures that moves more than 5 feet while within your reach also trigger opportunity attacks for you.
{@b Olympian Stance.} You assume the appropriate stance to throw weapons. While in this stance, thrown weapons have the Ranged property for you. Additionally, the weapons normal range is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Fighting Spirit
entries: More than just a style, every fighter has their own personality in the field of war, represented by their spirit.
You gain one Fighting Spirit from the Fighting Spirit list. This represents your character's approach to battle. You may not take another Spirit, even if you get the option from another source.
{@b Brutal.} You fight with tremendous brutality and recklessness.
You get +1 to your weapon attack rolls and your attacks deal an additional 1d4 damage, increasing to a d6 at 10th level and a d8 at 18th level in this class.
However, you take a -4 penalty to AC while doing so. You lose your benefits and penalty if you equip a shield.
{@b Swift.} You fight with a swift flurry of attacks.
When you roll for a weapon attack and the die is a 19 or 20, you can perform an additional attack as part of the same action. You can only have one additional attack per action from this feature.
However, while you are moving swiftly, you take a -2 penalty to your strength score. You lose your benefits and the penalty if you equip a non-light weapon or armor, or equip a shield.

{@b Tactical.} You can use your reaction and spend a use of your Action Surge to take an action during one of your allies' turn, provided you can see it and it is within 60ft of you. Additionally, when you take the Ready action to attack an enemy, the attack benefits from your Extra Attack feature if you have it.
However, you cannot use Action Surge on your own turn.
{@b Supportive.} You put your allies before yourself.

You can use your Second Wind feature on an ally you can see within 30 ft instead of yourself. Additionally, on your turn, you can use your action to grant Action Surge on an ally you can see within 30ft for their next turn.
However, your Action Surge and Second Wind features recharge on a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Artist
entries: Your martial abilities grow ever stronger.
You gain one additional fighting style. Additionally, after you finish a long rest, you may change your fighting styles acquired in this class. This represents your preparation for the battles ahead.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Superiority: Fighter
entries: When you choose this feature, you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

You learn two maneuvers of your choice from the Fighter list. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You gain one additional maneuver when you reach 10th level in this class. When you gain a level in this class you may choose to replace a known maneuver for a different one.

{@b Superiority Dice.} You have two Superiority dice, which are d6s. A Superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 10th level in this class.
{@b Saving Throws.} Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Provocateur
entries: You are good at making yourself a target.

Once on each of your turns, as an action, or in place of one of your attacks, you boast and taunt one creature you can see within 60 ft. The target must make a Wisdom Saving Throw against 8 + proficiency + your Charisma modifier.
A creature who fails their save takes 1d4 psychic damage and has disadvantage on its first attack roll against targets other than you.
Additionally, if an affected creature moves on its turn, it cannot end its movement further from you than it started with.
The damage increases by 1d4 and can target an additional enemy when you reach 5th level (2d4, 2 enemies), 11th level (3d4, 3 enemies), and 17th level (4d4, 4 enemies).

optionalfeature.name: Unwavering
entries: Whenever you use your Indomitable feature to reroll a failed saving throw, you can choose to make a Constitution Saving Throw instead of the Saving throw forced upon you.

optionalfeature.name: Unwinded
entries: Your well of stamina is more of a lake.

When you use your Second Wind feature, you may choose to instead gain the benefits of a Short Rest. When you do so, you may not spend more than 1 Hit die and you do not recover your Second Wind and Action Surge features.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: War Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Combo Breaker
entries: When an enemy hits you with a melee attack, you may use your reaction before any subsequent melee attack and spend 2 Ki points to attempt to interrupt its actions. It must make a constitution saving throw versus your ki save DC, if it fails, they must subtract your martial arts die from their attack rolls this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Combo Style
entries: When you use your bonus action to perform a Flurry of Blows, if all attacks you made this turn hit and were made at the same target, you may perform an additional attack as part of the same action. Roll that attack at disadvantage, if it hits, a Large or smaller target is also knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Executor Fist
entries: When you enter Inner Fury, you focus all your raging energy into a single devastating unarmed attack. The next time you hit an enemy with an unarmed strike, you deal extra damage equal to your martial arts die x your monk level.

Performing this attack takes its toll on your body, regardless of how many actions you can make this turn, after you successfully hit an enemy, both your turn and your Inner Fury end. You gain 2 points of exhaustion if you still had any Ki left when you performed this move, or 3 if you had none.
You lose all your remaning Ki points and take half your maximum hit points in damage.
If this damage would have put you under 0 hit points, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

optionalfeature.name: Impatient Defense
entries: Immediately after spending a Ki point to enter Patient Defense, you can make a single unarmed attack as part of the same bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Ki-Empowered Strikes
entries: Your unarmed strikes become even more powerful.

In addition to the effects of your Ki-Empowered Strikes feature, you gain +1 to attack and damage rolls you make unarmed. This effect does not stack with items that would also give a bonus to your attack and damage rolls while unarmed.
When you reach 9th level in this class, this bonus increases to +2. It increases again to +3 at 15th level.

optionalfeature.name: Inner Fury
entries: As an bonus action, you can spend 3 Ki points to leave aside all your honed calm and tranquility and focus your mind into unleashing every last bit of rage.

When you do so, until the end of your next turn, every attack you make deals maximum damage, rather than rolling for it. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Monastic School
entries: Choose one School of Monk Philosophy, each school has their own goals, ideals and approach to fighting.
{@b School of the Bear.} If you wish for peace, prepare for war.
Monks of the Bear School believe in peace through individual strength; one must be strong to protect themselves and others from evil.
Your martial arts die increases by one size (d4 - d6 - d8 - d10 - d12) and you gain +1 to AC while not wearing armor.
{@b School of the Eagle.} Truth is Vision, to see is to know, to know is to win.
Monks of the Eagle School believe that Vision and the ability to see truth amongst noise and falsehood is the ultimate virtue.
You gain proficiency in your choice between Insight or Perception if you don't already have it. If you're already proficient with it, you may add double your proficiency to its checks.
You are proficient with a ranged martial weapon of your choice that lacks the heavy property and it counts as a Monk weapon for you.
{@b School of the Snake.} Devils fear the tranquil man who goes to war.
Snake School monks assume the spirit of a coiled snake; an unwilling warrior: to fight when pushed to war, but never search for it.

As a bonus action, you can spend 2 Ki points to enter a Coiled Snake Stance. While in this state, your movement is reduced by half, and when an enemy successfully hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make one unarmed strike against it.
This lasts until the combat ends or you choose to end it as a bonus action.
{@b School of the Wolf.} Your people is your duty.
Wolf School Monks believe in fighting for their own.

When you hit an enemy with your Flurry of Blows feature, you mark the enemy for one minute. Your allies who hit a marked enemy have a +1 to their attack and damage rolls. You can only have one marked enemy at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Superiority: Monk
entries: When you choose this feature, you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

You learn two maneuvers of your choice from the Monk list. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You gain one additional maneuver when you reach 10th level in this class. When you gain a level in this class you may choose to replace a known maneuver for a different one.

{@b Superiority Dice.} You have two Superiority dice, which are d6s. A Superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 10th level in this class.
{@b Saving Throws.} Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Monastic Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Zen
entries: Your years meditating have allowed you to turn your mind into a blank.

As an action, you can enter a meditative state that soothes your mind and body. While in this state, you are immune to psychic damage, any effect that would sense your emotions or read your thoughts, divination spells, the charmed and frightened conditions and message spells and effects fail to deliver.
This state, however, does not foil wish spells and spells or effects of similar power used to affect your mind or to gain information about you.
You can mantain this state for 10 minutes, and it requires your concentration (as if concentrating on a spell).
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Adept Warrior
entries: You are an experienced warrior.

You gain one additional fighting style from the paladin list. Additionally, after you finish a long rest, you may change your fighting styles acquired in this class. This represents your preparation for the battles ahead.

optionalfeature.name: Aegis of Protection
entries: Your blessed powers protect those in need.

When you or an ally you can see within 30ft is hit with an attack, you can use your reaction to grant the target a bonus to its AC equal to your Charisma modifier, possibly turning the hit into a miss.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Blessed Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Crusader's Shield
entries: As a reaction, when an ally gets attacked by an enemy, you may try and interpose yourself to take the punishment in your ally's place. You must be able to see both the attacker and your ally and you must be within 5ft of your ally.
When you do so, you and a willing ally swap places, and the attack is directed against you instead.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Judgement
entries: As an action, you can spend one use of your Divine Sense to grant yourself advantage on insight and perception checks for 10 minutes.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Vessel
entries: You flow with Divine Energy.
You gain one additional use of your Channel Divinity feature, which is regained when you finish a short or long rest

optionalfeature.name: Lay on Healer
entries: Your healing capabilities improve in power.
Your pool of healing power from your Lay on Hands feature increases to your paladin level x 7.
Once per long rest you may use your Lay on Hands feature to heal an ally as a bonus action instead of an action, up to an amount equal to your paladin level x 2.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Superiority: Paladin
entries: When you choose this feature, you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

You learn two maneuvers of your choice from the Paladin list. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You gain one additional maneuver when you reach 10th level in this class. When you gain a level in this class you may choose to replace a known maneuver for a different one.

{@b Superiority Dice.} You have two Superiority dice, which are d6s. A Superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 10th level in this class.
{@b Saving Throws.} Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Mounted Crusader
entries: You always have the Find Steed spell prepared and it doesn't count against the maximum number of spells you can prepare. You can cast it once per long rest without spending a spell slot.
Opportunity attacks against you are made at disadvantage while you are mounted.

optionalfeature.name: Reach of Righteousness
entries: You reach your enemies wherever they are.
You may use your divine smite feature on ranged attacks as well as melee attacks. Your dice for ranged divine smites are d6s instead of d8s.
At 11th level, when you get your Improved Divine Smite feature, you may also apply a d6 instead of a d8 to your ranged attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Wide Influence
entries: Your influence grows ever so strongly.
Your features that produce auras increase in range by 10ft.

optionalfeature.name: Bloodied is How I Like It
entries: Once per long rest, when you take damage that reduces you to a quarter of your maximum hit points or less, you can choose to end one condition causing you to be Blinded, Deafened, Poisoned or Paralyzed.

optionalfeature.name: Dyson's Fury
entries: You are used to going down, but what matters is how hard you can get hit and keep moving forward.
When you make a death saving throw, roll 1d6 and add the die to your saving throw. If applying this bonus increases the total to 20 or higher, you gain the benefits of rolling a 20 on the d20.
Once per long rest, when you get up as a result of scoring 20 or higher on your death saves, you gain the benefits of Brace Up.

optionalfeature.name: Improvisational
entries: You are expert in improvising weaponry for use in battle.
Choose one of the following archetypes of improvised weapons to become an expert on. You may take this feature multiple times to learn other archetypes.
{@b Makeshift Blade.} A unorthodox blade. Can be a Butcher's Cleaver, a prison shank, a broken glass shard, a broken bottle or similar. Anything sharp and unusual.

While wielding this weapon, it counts as a pugilist weapon for you and you may use it as if it had the Finesse property. Once on each of your turns, when you hit an enemy with this weapon, you may force it to make a Constitution Saving Throw against 8 + your proficiency + your Strength modifier.

If it fails, it starts bleeding and takes damage equal to your {@italic Fisticuffs die} at the start of each of its turns. It can repeat this save at the end of each of its turns or take an action to staunch the bleeding. Does not work with constructs or undead. At 14th level, the bleeding stacks twice.

{@b Oversized Weapon.} A unwieldly and large object. Can be a booze keg, a tree trunk, a lamp post or similar object. Anything too large for a normal person to wield properly as a weapon. It has the Heavy and Two-Handed properties and it counts as a Pugilist weapon for you. You can use it with the Reach property as long as it is at least 10 ft long.

You can make attacks with this object and its damage equals twice your {@italic Fisticuffs die} + your Strength modifier. A non-reinforced object takes damage equal to the damage dealt and can potentially break after being used.
{@b Whip and Chain.} A long and flexible object. Can be a rope, a chain or similar object. It has the Reach property as long as it is at least 10ft long.

Once on each of your turns, when you hit an enemy with an attack using this type of improvised weapon, you may attempt to grapple with your weapon instead of a free hand as part of the same action. You can then choose to pull an enemy grappled in this way towards you if it is at most one size larger than you.
When you gain your {@italic Moxie Fueled Fists feature}, improvised weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity against non-magical attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Superiority: Pugilist
entries: When you choose this feature, you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

You learn two maneuvers of your choice from the Pugilist list. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You gain one additional maneuver when you reach 10th level in this class. When you gain a level in this class you may choose to replace a known maneuver for a different one.

{@b Superiority Dice.} You have two Superiority dice, which are d6s. A Superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 10th level in this class.
{@b Saving Throws.} Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Ruffian Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Scrap Style
entries: Some pugilists are know for their particular approach to fighting. Choose one of the following:

{@b Bear Hugger.} When you successfully grapple a target, you may deal damage equals to your {@italic Fisticuffs die} (minimum of a d6) + your Strength modifier. After a successfull grapple, as an action, or in place of one of your attacks, you may try to constrict your target. The enemy must make a Strength saving throw versus 8 + your proficiency + your Strength modifier, on a failure they take the same damage again.
{@b Raging Bull.} When you take the Dash action, your next melee attack this turn deals extra damage equals to your {@italic Fisticuffs die} (minimum of a d6).
Additionally, if you hit this attack, and you had spent a Moxie or Ki point to Dash (such as with {@italic Stick and Move} or {@italic Step of the Wind}), you regain your point spent.
{@b Stuntmaster.} You learn two maneuvers of your choice from among those available in the Pugilist list.

You gain one superiority die, which is a d6 (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended dice when you finish a short or long rest.

{@b Thrashing Gorilla.} When you shove a creature back you can push them 5ft multiplied by your Strength modifier. Additionally, when you successfuly shove a creature against something (or someone else) or if you shove it prone, you may deal damage equal to your {@italic Fisticuffs die} (minimum of a d6) + your Strength modifier to it.
{@b Tyson Step.} The first 10ft of movement you spend after making an unarmed attack against a creature does not provoke opportunity attacks.
You may take this Passive multiple times, gaining a different style each time. You may not take the same style twice regardless of source.

optionalfeature.name: Steel Chin
entries: You gain a bonus +1 to your AC when using your {@italic Iron Chin} feature to determine your Armor Class. Additionally, when you are using Iron Chin, you may reduce all bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage you take by 3.

optionalfeature.name: Warm-up Drills
entries: By running a couple warm-up drills before a fight, a pugilist is able to increase their effectiveness.
At the end of a short or long rest, or over the course of 10 minutes, you can perform one of the drills described below, each of them giving a different benefit.

Each drill gives benefits until your next short or long rest. You can only have on one of these drills active at a time. If you perform another warm-up while one is still active, you lose the benefits of the previous one.
{@b Shadowboxing drill.} You gain either two additional Moxie points or Superiority dice (your choice). You gain a +2 bonus to Strength Saving throws.
{@b Footwork drill.} You gain an extra 10 ft of walking speed. You gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity Saving throws.
{@b Conditioning drill.} You negate the next level of exhaustion you gain. You gain a +2 bonus to Constitution Saving throws.
{@b Full-Body drill.} You gain 5ft of movement. You gain a +1 to Strength, Dexterity and Constitution Saving throws. You gain either one additional Moxie point or Superiority die (your choice).
You can gain no more than your proficiency bonus per long rest of Moxie or Superiority dice.

optionalfeature.name: Brush it Off
entries: Whenever you take damage, you may use your reaction to end one condition affecting you. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you take a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Field Medic
entries: You can add your proficiency modifier to checks you make with Medicine. If you are already proficient with Medicine, you can add double your modifier instead.
You can recharge up to 1d4 charges to your Healer's Kit during a long rest in the wilderness by spending 1 hour foraging for useful herbs and materials.

Additionally, if you use your action to heal an ally with your Healer's kit, you can heal an additional ally as part of the same action (you can break up your movement if needed, and it costs 1 charge for each ally healed).

optionalfeature.name: Gaping Wounds
entries: Wounded animals don't survive in the wild.

Once per turn, when you or your companion/familiar makes an attack against an enemy marked by your Hunter's Mark or Favored Foe feature, its damage die increases by one size up to a maximum, displayed below. (d4 - d6 - d8 - d10 - d12 - 2d8).
At 2nd level, your maximum die is a d8.
At 6th level, your maximum die is a d10.
At 12th level, your maximum die is a d12.
At 18th level, your maximum die is 2d8.

optionalfeature.name: Honed Awareness
entries: {@italic Upgrades Primal Awareness and Primeval Awareness}
You have advantage with checks that rely on your sense of smell and your sense of hearing up to 60ft.

Also, as an action, you can concentrate for one minute and, instead of acquiring information from your favored enemy, you can choose to learn of any footprints or tracks in a 30ft radius around you, as well as any odors within 60ft not behind total cover and noises within 60ft regardless of cover.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Superiority: Ranger
entries: When you choose this feature, you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

You learn two maneuvers of your choice from the Ranger list. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You gain one additional maneuver when you reach 10th level in this class. When you gain a level in this class you may choose to replace a known maneuver for a different one.

{@b Superiority Dice.} You have two Superiority dice, which are d6s. A Superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 10th level in this class.
{@b Saving Throws.} Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Predator
entries: Whenever an enemy marked by your Hunter's Mark or Favored Foe feature dies, you can choose to gain the benefits of the Zephyr Strike spell for 1 minute (no action or concentration required).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Mark
entries: You know the Hunter's Mark spell, in addition to your number of Spells Known. Casting it does not cost a spell slot, but you can only have one marked enemy at a time.
{@italic Upgrades Favored Enemy}
Additionally, once per short rest you can cast a more powerful mark on your target, a Relentless Mark. In addition to its regular effects, Marked enemies count as being your Favored Enemy.
You can use this feature one additional time per short rest when you reach 11th level in this class.
{@italic Upgrades Favored Foe}
Your Favored Foe feature no longer requires concentration, however it does not stack with Hunter's Mark.
Additionally, after a marked enemy dies, you can immediately use your reaction to mark a new enemy.

optionalfeature.name: Sniper
entries: As a bonus action you may choose to take a prepared aim stance, lowering your profile and blending to your surroundings. To do so, you musn't have moved this turn, you count as being proned and your movement this turn is 0.
While in this stance, you don't have disadvantage on attack rolls by being prone and you gain an extra 50 feet to the normal and far ranges of your ranged weapons.
You can leave this state on any subsequent turn by spending movement as if leaving from prone.

optionalfeature.name: Wild Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Armor Piercer
entries: When you hit an enemy with an attack, if your attack beats the enemies' AC by 5 points or more, you can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the damage the target takes. Additionally, if you beat your enemies' AC by 10 points, you can roll one extra die (two extra dice in total).
This feature only affects the weapon's dice, and no other dice involved in the roll, such as Sneak Attack dice. This damage also does not get doubled in a critical strike.

optionalfeature.name: Belt of Tiny Tricks
entries: You have a belt of tiny tricks.
You can restock your belt by spending 5sp on supplies at a store and spending at least one hour setting up during a rest.

As a bonus action, you can retrieve a single item from your belt and use it. Each trick may only be used once before you have to prepare the bag again. Your DC for these tricks is equal to 8 + your proficiency + Dexterity modifier. You may choose one or roll a d6 for a random one:
{@b 1. Sand and Ground Glass.}

You can throw sand and ground glass up to 10ft onto a creature to attempt to blind it. A creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded for a number of turns equal your proficiency bonus. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect. A creature that doesn't have eyes or doesn't require sight is immune to this effect.
{@b 2. Caltrops.}

You can spread a single bag of caltrops to cover a 10-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1d4 piercing damage for every 5 ft traveled through it. A creature damaged in this way has its walking speed reduced by 10 feet until it leaves the area. A creature moving through the area at half speed automatically succeeds the saving throw.
{@b 3. Tiny Explosive.}

You lob a small explosive up to 60 feet away, which affects creatures in a 5ft radius. The explosion deals 1d8 fire damage to enemies who fail a Dexterity saving throw. This damage increases by 1d8 at 6th, 12th and 18th level in this class. Any flammable object that isn't being worn or held is lit on fire.
{@b 4. Bolases.}

You throw a set of bolases up to 30ft onto a target's feet. They must make a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. A Large creature has advantage on this saving throw, a bigger creature or a creature that does not rely on feet for movement is unaffected by it. Additionally, when you have the bolases at hand, you can use your reaction to throw them at an enemy that moves within 10ft of you.
{@b 5. Smoke Bomb.}

You throw a smoke bomb up to 60ft away, and it creates a 15ft radius cloud of smoke for one minute. Any creature has disadvantage on checks that rely on sight while inside the smoke bomb, and ranged attacks have disadvantage when attacking through it.
{@b 6. Fake Platinum coin.}
A well produced forgery. A creature must make a Wisdom (Investigation) check to spot the forgery. It always lands on Heads when you flick it.

optionalfeature.name: Cloak and Dagger
entries: You disappear in a moment's notice.

Once per long rest, you may cast Invisibility as an action on yourself without spending a spell slot.  Its benefit lasts for one hour. You lose the invisibility immediately after performing an Attack or casting a Spell or if you become incapacitated.

optionalfeature.name: Distracting Attack
entries: When you hit an enemy with an attack which meets the requirements for a Sneak Attack, you may choose to forego the Sneak Attack dice to instead rattle and distract your enemy.
They must make a Wisdom saving throw against 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Dexterity modifier.

On a failed save, you can use your Cunning Action to Hide and if successful, your enemy is unable to understand your movements and you are considered Hidden from that enemy until the end of your next turn, regardless if it can notice you. Attacking while hidden ends this effect.
On its turn, the enemy can use an action to make a Wisdom (Insight) check to focus on you, ending that effect.

optionalfeature.name: Expert
entries: One does not survive in your line of work without a sharp set of skills.
You gain proficiency in one skill, tool or language of your choice.
You gain expertise in one skill or tool of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Improvised Thievery
entries: You make do with what you've got.
A hair pin can be a lockpick, a broom can be a makeshift crowbar.

You gain proficiency with one set of artisan's tools of your choice and you become able to use improvised materials in place of your Thieves' Tools or any set of artisan's tools with which you are proficient. The improvised tools must make sense to be used in the way you describe (at the DMs discretion).
You may also spend one minute near a nonmagical lock and unlock it regardless of its difficulty. Once you use this feature you cannot use it again until you finish a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Low-Life Gambler
entries: You gain proficiency in a gaming set of your choice (Playing card set or dice) and any checks made with it. While using this set, you have advantage on checks made to fool someone.

Additionally, you can use them as thrown weapons with which you are proficient. Cards deal slashing damage and dice deal bludgeoning damage. You can engage in Two Weapon Fighting using your gaming set if you wield it with two hands, and you must adhere to its rules, but you may draw cards/dice with both hands as the same object interaction.
{@b Throwing Card/Dice:} 1d4 + dexterity slashing or bludgeoning damage. Finesse, Light, Thrown 30/60.
You throw additional cards/dice with levels in this class:
- 2 cards/dice dealing 2d4 + dexterity damage at 6th level.
- 3 cards/dice dealing 3d4 + dexterity damage at 12th level.
- 4 cards/dice dealing 4d4 + dexterity damage at 18th level.
Regardless of how many cards/dice you throw, it counts as a single attack, dealing the damage listed.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Superiority: Rogue
entries: When you choose this feature, you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

You learn two maneuvers of your choice from the Rogue list. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You gain one additional maneuver when you reach 10th level in this class. When you gain a level in this class you may choose to replace a known maneuver for a different one.

{@b Superiority Dice.} You have two Superiority dice, which are d6s. A Superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 10th level in this class.
{@b Saving Throws.} Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Misdirection
entries: At the end of a short or long rest, you can prepare a gadget to misdirect your enemies. It can be any sort of instantaneous effect such as a puff of smoke, a flash of light, or something that you could pass as being you.

As a reaction when you are hit, you can activate your misdirection, befuddling your enemy's attempt against you. As part of the same reaction, you must move up to 10ft away from your original position. If the triggering hit was an attack or a spell that targeted you, it misses. If it was an area of effect, it misses you only if you manage to leave the area using that movement.
Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you prepare it during a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Swindling Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Thug
entries: You spent time as a roughhouse to criminal sorts, being adept at solving issues with your own hands.
Your unarmed attacks count as Finesse weapons for you and you can use Acrobatics when trying to grapple enemies.

Additionally, when you hit an unarmed attack that meets the requirements for a sneak attack against an enemy, you can choose to forego the Sneak Attack damage to try to grapple them instead as part of the same action.

optionalfeature.name: Cantrip Versatility
entries: You intuitively know cantrips from various schools of knowledge.
Choose 2 cantrips from any spell list. These cantrips are Sorcerer spells for you and they don't count against your number of cantrips known.
At the end of a long rest, you may change your chosen cantrips.

optionalfeature.name: Facets of the Same Thread
entries: Magical knowledge flows to you.

Whenever you use a spell slot to cast a leveled spell, roll a d20, if you score a 20, you have an epyphany on the workings of a spell. When this happens, you learn one spell of the Sorcerer spell list for which you have slots and your number of Spells known increases by one.
You can have three spells learned in this way. You may learn an additional spell and get an extra spell known at 12th level and another at 18th level.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Font of Magic
entries: When you gain the Font of Magic feature, you get access to the following ways to spend your sorcery points.
{@b Empowering Reserves.} When you make an ability check on your turn, you can spend 2 sorcery points to gain advantage on the check.

{@b Imbuing Touch.} As an action, you can touch one nonmagical weapon and spend 3 sorcery points to imbue it with magic for 1 minute, which is then considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks. At 6th level, you also grant it a bonus to attack and damage rolls when you attack with it. The bonus equals half your proficiency modifier (rounded down).
{@b Sorcerous Fortitude.} As an action, you can spend any number of sorcery points to roll a d4 for each point expended. You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the total rolled.

optionalfeature.name: Innate Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Intuitive Spellcasting
entries: Casting spells comes naturally and intuitively to you.

When you gain additional Spells Known as you level up, you may choose to not learn one Spell. For instance, if you're a 5th level sorcerer, you may choose to have 5 spells known rather than the regular 6.

When you do this, once a day, you may intuitively use any spell available to you for which you have spell slots, learning that spell in the process. You can cast it normally until your next long rest, at which time you forget the spell and can choose another spell again.

optionalfeature.name: Magically Attuned Blood
entries: Once per long rest, as an action, you can spend a 1st level spell slot to imbue magic into an item that requires attunement; you learn its effects and attune to it immediately as if you had attuned to it over a rest. This item does not count against your maximum number of attunements.
You can only have one item attuned in this way. You can attune to one additional item when you reach 12th level.

optionalfeature.name: Metaspecialist
entries: You are a specialist in spell weaving.
You gain bonus Sorcery Points equal to your proficiency modifier and your maximum increases by the same amount.
Additionally, choose one Metamagic option among those you know. You can use this Metamagic option even if you have already used a different one during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Dregs
entries: Your mastery of your cantrips allows you to siphon away part of their power and be reused.

Whenever you use your action to cast a damaging cantrip that requires a melee spell attack or a melee attack as part of the casting, you can choose to spend a sorcery point to syphon part of the spell's power and release it again.

As part of the same action you use to cast the cantrip, make an additional melee spell attack. If it hits, it deals damage equals 1d4 + your Charisma modifier. The damage is of the same type the cantrip deals.
You don't need to spend a sorcery point to activate your Spell Dregs as long as you spent at least one sorcery point during this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Sudden Ignition
entries: You have one Ignition Point. Whenever you cast a leveled spell in combat, you can spend that point to immediately apply one of the following effects to the spell:
{@b Ignite: Adapt.} You can apply one metamagic option with a -1 to its Sorcery point cost.
{@b Ignite: Embolden.} The spell treats immunity to its damage type as resistance, and ignores regular resistance.
{@b Ignite: Strengthen.} You weave the spell in a solid magical thread, and it is cast as if it were of one level higher.

Whenever you cast a leveled spell with no Ignition Points remaining, roll a d20. If the result is a 19 or 20, you regain your Ignition Point in a sudden flash of understanding on the inner workings of magic.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Enspell Blade
entries: Bursts of magical energy empower your attacks.

When you use your Arcane Step feature, or when you successfully negate an enemy's spell (such as with {@italic Counterspell, Spell Parry} or by breaking the enemy's concentration), your next attack deals an additional 1d4 damage.
The damage is of an element equal to the negated spell's damage type. It instead deals force damage if the spell doesn't deal damage or if you triggered this feature by Arcane Stepping.
The damage increases to 1d6 at 6th level, to 1d8 at 12th level, and to 1d10 at 18th.

optionalfeature.name: Fighting Styles
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.
{@b Arcane Warrior.}

You learn two more cantrips of your choice from the swordmage spell list. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of these cantrips with another cantrip from the swordmage spell list.
{@b Archery.}
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
{@b Defense.}
While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
{@b Great Weapon Fighting.}
When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even
if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-
handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.
{@b Two-Weapon Fighting.}
When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Spell Parry
entries: Immediately after succeeding in thwarting an enemy's spell with your Spell Parry feature, you can perform an Arcana check as part of the same reaction, with the DC equal to the enemy's spell save DC.
On a success, you siphon a portion of the enemy's magic to yourself and can use it to immediately cast a cantrip as part of the same reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Magically Armored
entries: You can choose one of the armors magically bound to you via your Magical Armory feature and heighten its defensive properties.
While you are wearing it, it grants you a +1 bonus to your saving throws against magical effects you can see.
At 12th level, this bonus increases to +2.

optionalfeature.name: Thesis: Bard
entries: You learn one spell from the Bard spell list of your choice, for which you have spell slots. This spell does not count towards your number of spells known and it counts as a Swordmage spell for you.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can change the spell you choose for a different Bard spell.

optionalfeature.name: Thesis: Cleric
entries: You learn one spell from the Cleric spell list of your choice, for which you have spell slots. This spell does not count towards your number of spells known and it counts as a Swordmage spell for you.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can change the spell you choose for a different Cleric spell.

optionalfeature.name: Thesis: Druid
entries: You learn one spell from the Druid spell list of your choice, for which you have spell slots. This spell does not count towards your number of spells known and it counts as a Swordmage spell for you.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can change the spell you choose for a different Druid spell.

optionalfeature.name: Thesis: Sorcerer
entries: You learn one spell from the Sorcerer spell list of your choice, for which you have spell slots. This spell does not count towards your number of spells known and it counts as a Swordmage spell for you.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can change the spell you choose for a different Sorcerer spell.

optionalfeature.name: Thesis: Warlock
entries: You learn one spell from the Warlock spell list of your choice, for which you have spell slots. This spell does not count towards your number of spells known and it counts as a Swordmage spell for you.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can change the spell you choose for a different Warlock spell.

optionalfeature.name: Thesis: Wizard
entries: You learn one spell from the Wizard spell list of your choice, for which you have spell slots. This spell does not count towards your number of spells known and it counts as a Swordmage spell for you.
Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can change the spell you choose for a different Wizard spell.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Pact
entries: As you grow stronger, you learn how to make pacts of your own.

As an action over the next 10 minutes, you and a willing ally form a Blood Pact. Both of you must spend and roll 2 Hit Dice and deduct the amount rolled from your and your allies' current and maximum hit points.
Until the next long rest, your ally gains limited powers, akin to yours. Choose one of the following:
{@b - Your ally learns one cantrip you know.}
{@b - Your ally learns one Eldritch Invocation you know.}
{@b - Your ally gains one warlock spell slot of 2nd level and learns one spell (up to 2nd level) you know.}

Your ally uses your spellcasting for these spells, but they are cast by them. The pact lasts until either of you takes a long rest, either of you dies or you end it as an action. Your maximum hit points can't be restored until the pact is broken.

optionalfeature.name: Effortless Power
entries: Choose one 1st level spell from the warlock spell list. You can cast this spell twice at its lowest level without spending spell slots, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
You can cast that spell an additional time when you reach 12th level.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Improved Patronage
entries: You gain one additional Pact Magic Spell Slot.

optionalfeature.name: Invoker
entries: You gain one additional Eldritch Invocation.
At the end of a long rest, you can choose to change one of your Invocations for another that you meet the requirements for.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Intercession
entries: As an action, you can ask your patron for a small boon.
Roll a Charisma ability check vs your spell save DC. On a success, you grab your patron's attention.

The patron ultimately chooses whether or not it intervenes, or if it will punish you for contacting it, depending on your standing with it or if you can persuade it.  Pestering your patron can have poor consequences.
You patron decides how to intervene. It will only intervene in a minor manner, and if it decides to cast a spell in this way, it will not exceed 5th level.
If your patron intervenes, for better or worse, you can't use this feature again for 7 days.
Otherwise, you can use it again after you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Outwordly Knowledge
entries: You ask your patron for knowledge, and they answer in kind.
Once per long rest, as an action, you may ask your patron about a course of action, as if casting the spell Augury.
Your patron answers to the best of its abilities, but its concept of good or bad outcome (weal or woe) comes from its perspective.

optionalfeature.name: Supernatural Gate
entries: You create a portal to your patron's realm.

As a bonus action, choose an unoccupied 5x5ft space within 60 feet of you. A portal appears at that location, from which otherwordly entities can be seen (such as fey or fiends), but not interacted with.

The Gate is a magical object and occupies its space. It has 18 AC and hitpoints equal to three times your warlock level. As long as the Gate remains, any warlock spell you cast can be done using the gate as its point of origin. For example, a fiend's hand could be seen reaching out of the Gate and casting a Firebolt before disappearing inside it.
As a bonus action on your turn, you may change the gate's position up to 30ft, disappearing and reappearing on its new location.
While the Gate is open, you can take a bonus action on your turn to disintegrate your material body and reappear coming out of your Gate, unharmed. After using this action, the Gate closes.

No creature can pass through the Gate, nor can it be used to contact your Patron directly. The Gate lasts for 1 minute or until you close it (no action required). The Gate also closes if it is ever more than 90 ft away from you or if its hit points are reduced to 0.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Feature
entries: You can choose to learn a Feat from the Intermediary or Lesser Feats list. This feat is a Class Feat for you, and you may not take another Intermediary or Lesser Feat through Class Passives even if you get the option later (such as with multiclassing).

optionalfeature.name: Battle Mage
entries: You acquire a limited martial knowledge.
You become proficient with Light Armor and one of the following:
• One martial weapon and shields
• One fighting style of your choice from the Fighter list.

optionalfeature.name: Fractured Mind
entries: You gain the ability to hold concentration on two spells at once.

When you do so, you must roll a Constitution Saving throw at the end of each of your turns to mantain your concentration for the next round. The DC for the check is 10, and increases by 5 on each subsequent round.
All other Constitution Saving throws to mantain concentration are made at disadvantage while concentrating on two spells.

optionalfeature.name: Overloaded Spell
entries: You learn how to burn through your mind to deliver a mighty spell.

Whenever you cast a leveled spell that deals damage, you may choose to spend an additional spell slot of the same level used in the casting to Overload it. When you do so, the spell ignores resistances to its damage type and treats immunity as resistance.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Palm Casting
entries: You learn how to deliver your spells at the end of an open palm unarmed strike. You gain the following benefits:

When you cast a spell that requires a ranged spell attack, you can make a melee spell attack instead. Also, if a spell requires a melee attack as part of its casting, it can be performed using your palm instead of a weapon, unless the weapon would be consumed in its casting.

Immediately before you cast a spell that targets or includes a creature within 5ft of you, you can choose to make an unarmed strike against that creature as part of the same action.
